title: Marine Engineering at the Management Level

children.title: Definition of Terms
children.description: Defining the meaning of International System of Units, Force, Pressure, Weight, Density, Relative Density, Work, Energy

children.title: Thermodynamics
children.description: A branch of physics which deals with the relationship between heat, energy, and work on a system. There are three principal laws of thermodynamics.

children.title: Heat
children.description: An energy that is transferred to a system by way of thermal interaction. Introduces the heat engine, turbine, compressors, thermodynamic cycle, working fluid, temperature-entropy, enthalpy-entropy, pressure-enthalpy, heat transfer, heat conduction

children.title: Gas Laws
children.description: Relationship between pressure, volume, and temperature. Introduction of law of heat conduction, Newton's Law of Cooling, Heat Exchangers, Air Conditioning, Boyle's Law, Charles' Law, Ideal Gas Law, Polytrophic Law, Specific Heat Capacity, Psychometric Chart, Mollier Diagram, Marine Applications

children.title: Steam Plant
children.description: In relation to water and defining wet steam, saturated steam, super heated steam, enthalpy, entropy, evaporation, condensation, boiler horsepower

children.title: Mechanics
children.description: Inertia at the resistance to change of motion, the method of balancing a disc, the normal tolerance of out-of-balance forces, the static balancing of propeller, the dynamic balancing of rotating elements (impellers, bowl assembly of purifiers, crankshaft).

children.title: Hydraulics and Pneumatics
children.description: Fundamental concepts, component symbols, construction, functions and application to Hydraulics and Pneumatics, circuit diagrams, and troubleshooting of fluid power systems, shipboard applications
